revised_title: A Firsthand Account of the Taunton Earthquake in 1747
tldr: The author, John Forster, provides a detailed account of the Taunton earthquake that occurred on July 1, 1747. He describes the rumbling noise and significant shaking experienced, as well as the subsequent panic and fear among the townspeople. The earthquake was felt throughout a large area, extending from the South Chanel to the Severn and from Exeter to Crookhorn.
